thread.title: For a future Auburn linebacker, gun violence in Birmingham is a part of life
thread.title_full: For a future Auburn linebacker, gun violence in Birmingham is a part of life

author: Joseph Goodman | jgoodman@al.com
title: For a future Auburn linebacker, gun violence in Birmingham is a part of life
text: All families of college-bound high schoolers can relate to the stresses and worries related to college entrance exams. In a city so divided socioeconomically, however, being shot while going to take the ACT is something hard to understand for many. But Tadarian Moultry of Jackson-Olin, who is one of Auburn's top recruits, has already been shot once, and so has his older brother. Their uncle was paralyzed in a shooting, and they have many other family connections to gun violence.
